question.title: Issues with Java and Snowflake JDBC
question.body:
I have a program that is able to connect to Snowflake but whever it tries to run a query it fails and says to add:

--add-opens=java.base/java.nio=org.apache.arrow.memory.core,ALL-UNNAMED

to the compile, which I did. Now whenever I run the program I get:

Unknown module: org.apache.arrow.memory.core specified to --add-opens

I have also tried:

--add-opens=java.base/java.nio=ALL-UNNAMED

I am coding/debugging in Eclipse Version: 2025-03 (4.35.0)

I am using JDK 24

with the following jars in the Modulepath:

snowflake-jdbc-3.24.2.jar arrow-memory-core-18.3.0.jar jna-5.17.0.jar

I have no clue what I am doing wrong and why it is saying it cannot find the module org.apache.arrow.memory.core

Although the arrow jar does not show a module called "core" in it, which seems odd?

Any help greatly appreciated.

question_comments.body: Try to add logs / errors helps to understand it better. I am also using --add-opens=java.base/java.nio=ALL-UNNAMED mine work fine
Please provide enough code so others can better understand or reproduce the problem.
